alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 10:20PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hamilton, Warren and northwestern Washington Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1019 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Eagle Point Campground to 6 miles northeast of Sacandaga Campground. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Warrensburg, Lake George Village, Johnsburg, Hague, Eagle Point Campground, Scaroon Manor Public Campground, Bolton Landing, Rogers Rock Campground, Chestertown, North Creek, Huletts Landing, Putnam, Mount Hope, Bolton, Wright, Thurman, Lake George, Stony Creek, Harrisburg and Thurman Station. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 22 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Hamilton; Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren
